commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: swap out to use OOP + error handling
commitResults.messageBody: Added OOP abstraction and error handling for 2 types of errors (Incorrect argument and Unknown commands)

I added persistence by using a csv-esque format. Of course, I didn't have the interest to take care of malicious inputs where the task description is the same as the delimiter used (`|`) so I just outright banned it.
Users can now input date strings into their tasks. If an invalid format is added, a parsing exception is thrown to reflect to the user.
ui class to handle ui stuff.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: move all files into `duke` package
fix: downgrade jdk to match gradle merge
commitResults.messageBody: I was using Java 21 and when I downgraded I was denied the syntactic sugar privileges that 21 gave :sad
docs: add documentation
Added my first custom intro to the bot!
The bot can now repeat whatever the user inputs.
The bot can now add tasks and list them.
Tasks now can be marked as done and their status is also shown when listed.

Add 3 variants of Tasks which all inherit from tasks. I also introduced OOP as I noticed a lot of duplicated code that's all in one file. I basically created a Parser that parses user input to ouptut commands, a State class to hold the state of the app, and variants of Commands to execute the user's intentions.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Swap out to use OOP + error handling
commitResults.messageBody: Added OOP abstraction and error handling for 2 types of errors (Incorrect argument and Unknown commands)
Users can now delete tasks.
Added input test cases and expected output so that the bot is tested reliably.

I added persistence by using a csv-esque format. Of course, I didn't have the interest to take care of malicious inputs where the task description is the same as the delimiter used (`|`) so I just outright banned it.
Users can now input date strings into their tasks. If an invalid format is added, a parsing exception is thrown to reflect to the user.
ui class to handle ui stuff.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Move all files into `duke` package
fix: Downgrade jdk to match gradle merge
commitResults.messageBody: I was using Java 21 and when I downgraded I was denied the syntactic sugar privileges that 21 gave :sad
Added a unit test for the `Parser` class to ensure that the Parser has all it's edge cases covered.
Added unit tests for State class to make sure State class works as expected.
Added documentation so that developers who work on this project can navigate around the project.
Now users can find tasks by searching for its description with a `find <text>` command.
feat: Add find command

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: Remove wildcard import for Storage
commitResults.messageBody: Adhere to the norms!

commitResults.messageTitle: style: Rename boolean to adhere to standards
commitResults.messageBody: I named some of my booleans as `done` but it should have a prefix like `is`/`was`/etc. I've made the necessary changes.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: Remove indentation in switch statements
commitResults.messageBody: Unindented the `case`s in the switch statement.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Add FXML files and resources

commitResults.messageBody:
For this I had to refactor and return a `String` when executing commands so that I can pass it to the `MainWindow` controller to output the text when communicating.

Other than that, I've added in the primary work of the GUI and it's working fully :fire

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: Add in missing return comments for execute
commitResults.messageBody: I didn't include what the `execute` command returns in the JavaDocs.
feat: Add JavaFX GUI

Currently, there are no assertions within the codebase, which is not ideal as there are points where we do make assumptions about how the code behaves.

To correct this, Assertions are added in places deemed fit to make such assertions. For example, in the `DeleteCommand`, we assert that the index is within bounds before executing a delete. Another example would be list where the StringBuilder that we're returning does not return an empty output (even when there's no tasks).

These are fair assertions to make.

The `CommandType` Enum was being used to label the nature of commands executed.

However, these enums were not being used anywhere in the code other than to label the command. It remains a persistent issue as after going through many iterations, this enum marking was not being used anywhere in the codebase, which signifies the presence of dead code.

Removing the Enum completely allows us to reduce the codebase size whilst maintaining good meaning within the codebase for other developers.

The whole enum is wiped as it is not necessary to remain in the codebase.
refactor: remove `CommandType` Enum
feat: Add assertions

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Allow users to view schedule for a day
commitResults.messageBody: This commit adds a `view_schedule <date>` command that allows users to view the Deadlines and Events that fall under the specified date.
